skill.name: regulatory-affairs-head
skill.description: Senior Regulatory Affairs Manager expertise for HealthTech and MedTech companies. Provides strategic regulatory guidance, submission management, regulatory pathway analysis, global compliance coordination, and cross-functional team leadership. Use for regulatory strategy development, submission planning, regulatory risk assessment, and team coordination activities.
skill.summary: Senior Regulatory Affairs Manager expertise for HealthTech and MedTech companies. Provides strategic...
skill.author: alirezarezvani

security_audit.summary: All 29 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill is a legitimate regulatory affairs documentation package with no malicious code. The static scanner incorrectly flagged regulatory terminology (e.g., 'Module C2', 'design controls') as security keywords and markdown code formatting as shell execution. The Python script performs standard JSON file I/O for submission tracking.

content.user_title: Lead Regulatory Strategy for Medical Devices
content.value_statement: Medical device companies face complex global compliance requirements across FDA, EU MDR, and ISO standards. This skill provides senior regulatory affairs leadership to develop submission strategies, coordinate cross-functional teams, and navigate approval pathways efficiently.
actual_capabilities: Develop regulatory strategies aligned with FDA, EU MDR, and ISO standards
Manage submission workflows from pre-submission through approval
Analyze regulatory pathways and recommend optimal submission routes
Coordinate cross-functional teams across quality, engineering, and clinical functions
Monitor submission status and generate compliance reports
Assess regulatory risks and recommend mitigation strategies
limitations: Does not provide legal advice or replace qualified regulatory counsel
Cannot submit applications directly to regulatory authorities
Does not access real-time regulatory databases or authority systems
Requires human review for final submission accuracy and compliance verification

use_cases.title: Build Submission Strategy
use_cases.description: Develop comprehensive regulatory roadmap for new medical device launches across multiple markets.

use_cases.title: Align Teams on Compliance
use_cases.description: Coordinate regulatory requirements across quality, clinical, and engineering departments.

use_cases.title: Navigate FDA and EU Pathways
use_cases.description: Understand regulatory requirements for bringing medical devices to US and EU markets.

prompt_templates.title: New Device Strategy
prompt_templates.scenario: Planning regulatory approach for new product
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me develop a regulatory strategy for a Class II medical device targeting US and EU markets. What submission pathways should we consider and what is the recommended timeline?

prompt_templates.title: Submission Checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a comprehensive checklist for a 510(k) submission including required sections, performance testing requirements, and predicate device considerations.

prompt_templates.title: Risk Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a regulatory risk assessment for our device lifecycle. What are the key risks and how should we mitigate them?

prompt_templates.title: Team Coordination
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me establish communication protocols and handoff procedures between regulatory, quality, and engineering teams for our submission project.

output_examples.input: What regulatory pathway should we pursue for a novel cardiac monitoring device?
output: Classify your device based on intended use and risk level
Consider De Novo pathway if no predicate exists
EU MDR requires Notified Body for Class IIa devices
Engage with FDA Q-Sub program early for guidance

output_examples.input: Help us prepare for our EU MDR technical documentation submission
output: Compile device description and intended purpose per Annex II
Complete risk management file per ISO 14971
Prepare clinical evaluation report per Annex XIV
Ensure UDI registration and EUDAMED compliance

output_examples.input: How do we coordinate regulatory activities across departments?
output: Define clear escalation procedures for regulatory decisions
Create shared submission timeline with milestone ownership
Implement document control and version management
Conduct quarterly compliance training for all teams

best_practices: Start regulatory planning early in product development to avoid delays
Maintain consistent documentation aligned with ISO 13485 design controls
Engage regulatory authorities through pre-submission meetings when possible
anti_patterns: Waiting until late development phases to involve regulatory expertise
Assuming EU MDR and FDA requirements are identical or interchangeable
Overlooking post-market surveillance requirements during initial planning

faq.question: What submission types does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports FDA 510(k), PMA, De Novo and EU MDR, ISO certification pathways with configurable tracking.

faq.question: Can this skill prepare actual regulatory submissions?
faq.answer: Provides guidance, templates, and checklists but requires human review and official submission by qualified professionals.

faq.question: Does this skill access regulatory databases?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance based on regulatory frameworks but does not query external databases.

faq.question: What regulatory frameworks are covered?
faq.answer: Covers FDA 21 CFR, EU MDR 2017/745, ISO 13485, ISO 14971, and global market pathways.

faq.question: How does this skill coordinate teams?
faq.answer: Provides communication protocols, escalation procedures, and cross-functional meeting frameworks.

faq.question: Is this suitable for healthtech startups?
faq.answer: Yes. Provides strategic guidance for navigating regulatory complexity with limited resources.
